Submodules¶

pydra.core.base module¶

class pydra.core.base.PydraObject(connections: dict, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for pydra objects implementing zmq sockets for communicating between processes.

Parameters

connections (dict) –

Dictionary of all connections used in the pydra network. Each pydra object in the network should be represented in this dictionary with a unique key (the object’s name), dictionary pair. The object’s connection dictionary should have any number of the following keys and corresponding values:

  • publisher (str)

    The port on which the object publishes its outputs.

  • subscriptions (iterable)

    Elements should be a tuple of (name, port, message types). The name is the name of the worker to receive message from, the port is the port on which to subscribe to messages from this worker, and the message types are an iterable of ZMQMessage types to listen for.

  • sender (str)

    The port to which the object pushes messages with the PUSH|PULL pattern. Implemented by the Saver subclass for sending messages back to the main pydra class.

  • receiver (str)

    The port on which to receive messages from a PUSH|PULL pattern. Implemented by main pydra class for receiving messages from Saver.

name¶

Unique name of the pydra object. Must be specified in subclasses.

Type

str

msg_handlers¶

A dictionary that maps ZMQMessage types to appropriate handling methods.

Type

dict

events¶

A dictionary that maps named events to corresponding methods. New worker-specific events can be added in subclasses.

Type

dict

zmq_context¶

The zmq context object for implementing 0MQ functionality.

Type

zmq.Context

zmq_connections¶

A copy of the object’s specific connections from the dictionary provided by the connections parameters.

Type

dict

zmq_publisher¶

The zmq.PUB socket for publishing messages.

Type

zmq.Socket (only if “publisher” provided in connections)

zmq_subscriptions¶

A dictionary of zmq.SUB sockets for receiving messages from named workers in the network.

Type

dict of zmq.Socket (only if “subscriptions” provided in connections)

zmq_poller¶

Poller object for receiving messages from subscribed sockets.

Type

zmq.Poller (only if “subscriptions” provided in connections)

zmq_sender¶

The zmq.PUSH socket for sending messages.

Type

zmq.Socket (only if “sender” provided in connections)

zmq_sender¶

The zmq.PULL socket for receiving messages.

Type

zmq.Socket (only if “receiver” provided in connections)

See also

pydra.pydra.Pydra, pydra.core.saving.Saver, pydra.core.workers.Worker, pydra.core.process

pydra.core.process module¶

class pydra.core.process.ProcessMixIn(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Mix-in class for running pydra objects in a separate process.

Provides such classes with a run method that is called after the object is instantiated in a separate process. Also provides a start classmethod that launches the object in a separate process.

exit_flag¶
Type

int

cleanup()[source]¶

Called immediately before process terminates.

close()[source]¶

Sets the exit_flag, causing process to terminate.

run()[source]¶

Calls setup, and then enters an endless loop that calls the _process method for as long as the exit_flag is not set.

setup()[source]¶

Called once as soon as the object is created in a separate process.

classmethod start(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Launches the object in a separate process. Parameters are the same as the constructor.

class pydra.core.process.PydraProcess(worker_type, worker_args, worker_kwargs, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: multiprocessing.context.Process

Class for running pydra objects in a separate process.

The run method of PydraProcess calls the constructor for the worker class and then calls the run method of the newly created object.

Parameters

  • worker_type (type) – Worker type (should be a subclass of PydraObject and ProcessMixIn).

  • worker_args (iterable) – Arguments passed with star to the constructor of the worker pydra object.

  • worker_kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments passed with double star to the constructor of the worker pydra object.

worker¶

An instance of a PydraObject class.

Type

PydraObject

run()[source]¶

Method to be run in sub-process; can be overridden in sub-class

pydra.core.protocol module¶

class pydra.core.protocol.Protocol(name, repetitions, interval)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

Class for creating and running protocols.

Protocols are a queued sequence of events, timers and triggers. Events can be any callable method or function, timers introduce waits within the protocol, and triggers allow external triggers to be received before continuing. Protocols also allow for a “free-running mode”, which will cause the protocol to run continuously until interrupted.

Protocols may be repeated any number of times with a time gap in between repetitions.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the protocol.

  • repetitions (int) – Number of times protocol is to be repeated.

  • interval (float) – Time between repetitions of the protocol.

event_queue¶

A list of events, timers and triggers within the protocol.

Type

list

rep¶

The current repetition number.

Type

int

timer¶

Timer for controlling interval between repetitions.

Type

QtCore.QTimer

flag¶

Internal flag for whether the protocol is currently running (includes repetitions and inter-rep intervals).

Type

bool

Notes

The event queue is a list of Queued, Timer and TriggerContainer objects. These objects all implement a __call__ method and contain a “finished” Qt signal. The finished signal of each object connect to the __call__ method of the next object in the event queue.

  • For Queued object, the finished signal emits as soon as the queued method returns.

  • For Timer objects, the finished signal emits after a predefined elapsed time.

  • For TriggerContainer objects, the finished signal emits when the Trigger object emits its triggered signal.

The free-running mode implements a special case of a TriggerContainer, whereby a trigger is never received and so a finished signal is never emitted.

addEvent(method: callable, *args, **kwargs) → None[source]¶

Add an event to the protocol.

Parameters

  • method (callable) – Any object that implements a __call__ method.

  • args (iterable) – Arguments passed to method when called.

  • kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments passed to method when called.

Add a timer to the protocol.

pydra.core.trigger module¶

class pydra.core.trigger.FreeRunningMode[source]¶

Bases: pydra.core.trigger.Trigger

A dummy Trigger class that never emits a triggered signal.

check()[source]¶

Method to check for the trigger. Should be overridden in subclasses.

setup()[source]¶

Called after the thread starts but before the event loop starts. May be overridden in subclasses.

class pydra.core.trigger.Trigger(timeout=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QThread

Base class for receiving triggers in PyQt.

Trigger objects are a type of QtCore.QThread that contain their own event loop. The event loop is started when the object is called.

Parameters

timeout (int (optional)) – The timeout time of the trigger (in milliseconds).

Notes

When the thread begins, a setup method is called (allowing for resetting of attributes etc.). While the event loop is running, the Trigger object constantly checks whether a trigger has been received (via the check method). If a trigger has been received, the triggered signal may be emitted. If a timeout time has been specified, the thread will terminate after the specified time has elapsed. The class also implements an interrupt method, that allows the thread to be terminated by signal from another thread.

check()[source]¶

Method to check for the trigger. Should be overridden in subclasses.

interrupt()[source]¶

Terminates the thread. Subclasses should include call to super.

run(self)[source]¶
setup()[source]¶

Called after the thread starts but before the event loop starts. May be overridden in subclasses.

timed_out()[source]¶

Emits a timeout signal if the timeout time has elapsed, then tnterrupts the thread.

timeout¶
triggered¶

class pydra.core.workers.Worker(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pydra.core.base.PydraObject, pydra.core.process.ProcessMixIn

Base worker class. Receives and handles messages. Runs in a separate process.

name¶

A unique string identifying the worker. Must be specified in all subclasses.

Type

str

subscriptions¶

Names of other workers in the network from which this one can receive data and events.

Type

tuple

pipeline¶

The name of the pipeline to which this worker belongs. Only necessary if there are multiple data streams that need to be saved separately.

Type

str

connected(*args, **kwargs)¶
exit(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets the exit_flag when EXIT signal is received, causing process to terminate.

name = 'worker'¶
pipeline = ''¶
subscriptions = ()¶
